As !NautilusSvn is under active development it's advised to keep track of [http://groups.google.com/group/nautilussvn/ the mailing list] and/or the [http://cobradragon.com/nautilussvn/ blog].

Installing the !NautilusSvn beta release is currently the easiest for users of Ubuntu, however we've written up extensive installation instructions for users of other Linux distros.

<table border="0" cellpadding="5">
<tr>
<td>[http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/files/nautilussvn_0.12-1ubuntu2_all.deb http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/media/ubuntu.png]</td>
<td>
*Debian package for Ubuntu 8.10 and 8.04*

[http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/files/nautilussvn_0.12-1ubuntu2_all.deb Download this] if you are running Ubuntu, no need to follow any instructions apart from enabling the community repository.
</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td>[http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/files/nautilussvn_0.12-beta1-2.tar.gz http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/svn/wiki/media/tarball.png]</td>
<td>
*Tarball for manual installation*

[http://nautilussvn.googlecode.com/files/nautilussvn_0.12-beta1-2.tar.gz Download this] if you are running another distro. Follow the [http://code.google.com/p/nautilussvn/wiki/v012_Installation manual installation instructions].
</td>
</tr>
</table>

Be sure to restart Nautilus (nautilus -q && nautilus &) for NautilusSvn to get loaded.

== Development snapshots ==

Currently we're regularly creating snapshots of our development version (trunk). We consider these snapshots stable enough for actual usage, heck we personally run trunk and have yet to lose any precious modifications `*knocks on wood*` ;-).
